intro: Salicornia littorea, commonly known as sea beet, is a halophyte plant that thrives in saline environments. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves that are often red or pink in color. This plant is typically found in coastal areas, salt marshes, and other brackish habitats. Its ability to tolerate high salt concentrations makes it an important component of coastal ecosystems. Salicornia littorea plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
